title: Elysian Fields 4 CDs EAC FLAC Mazzy star like indie
description:
Elysian Fields got kickstarted in the mid 1990s in the NYC indie music scene. Although I have likened them to Mazzy Star in that the songs are slow paced and spearheaded by the whispering, seductive and haunting vocals of Jennifer Charles, the music has a darker, more gothic and in places overtly erotic tone with measures of psychedelia tossed in for good measure. Found in most tracks is a plucked bass that has unusual power and tonality, and is quite capable of shaking the glass out of your picture frames. 

The overall sound is too unique to categorize, but I believe is rooted in the Serge Gainsbourg style of sensuous melancholia. 

It is possible to get other torrents of this music, but none of them I have seen are lossless FLACs-and this music is excellent enough for it to be experienced in full fidelity. Also included are 800 dpi scans of all the artwork and liner info. 

You may not like this music, but only if your tastes are of low breeding!
